conclusion: Analyze the paths the liquid will take from baffles A, B, C, and D to containers E or F.
Liquid from A flows downward and to the right, passing through the gap between the blue and yellow bars.
Liquid from A ends up in container E.
Liquid from B flows downward and to the left, passing through the gap between the gray and yellow bars.
Liquid from B ends up in container F.
Liquid from C flows downward and to the right, passing through the gap between the red and yellow bars.
Liquid from C ends up in container E.
Liquid from D flows downward and to the left, passing through the gap between the yellow and cyan bars.
Liquid from D ends up in container F.
Liquids from A and C flow into container E.
Liquids from B and D flow into container F.
The liquid from baffles A and C will flow into container E.
The liquid from baffles B and D will flow into container F.
Final Answer: Liquid from A and C flows into container E. Liquid from B and D flows into container F.
